subject: Politics
title: Why Revolutions Fail
description: A quick win: understand Why Revolutions Fail.

hook.text: Most revolutions replace one tyrant with another. Overthrowing a regime is easy. Building a better one is not.

buildup.text: After the old regime falls, power vacuums create chaos. Factions fight over who leads the new order.

discovery.text: Revolutionary leaders often lack governing skills. Fighting an enemy is different from running a country.

twist.text: Revolutions eat their own. France, Russia, China, and Iran all purged their early leaders within years.

climax.text: External interference dooms many revolutions. Foreign powers back rival factions and fuel civil wars.

punchline.text: Revolutions are easy to start. Building what comes after is the real test.

quiz.question: Why do many revolutions fail to deliver their promises?
options: Power vacuums, factional fighting, and leaders who lack governing skills
Revolutions always lead to immediate peace and prosperity
Foreign powers always support revolutionary movements
